snippet: A year after South Sudan declared independence from Sudan, both countries are caught up in a destructive game and will only end up sabotaging themselves.
abstract: Editorial marvels at the lengths to which Sudan and South Sudan have gone to sabotage each other, and themselves, in a destructive game of cross-border attacks and economic showdowns; calls on the international community to continue to working with both sides to resolve disputes over oil, border and protections for minorities.
lead_paragraph: A year after South Sudan declared independence from Sudan, both countries are caught up in a destructive game and will only end up sabotaging themselves.
